required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NiteCAPP: Web-based Interventions for Insomnia in Rural Dementia Caregivers
clinical_study.official_title: NiteCAPP: Web-based Interventions for Insomnia in Rural Dementia Caregivers: Examination of Sleep, Arousal, Mood, Cognitive, and Immune Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: Compared to their urban counterparts, rural family dementia caregivers (CGs) face increased vulnerability to insomnia and related health concerns (stress, inflammation, depression, anxiety, cognitive disturbance). Cognitive and behavioral treatments for insomnia hold promise for improving insomnia and these related concerns, but is difficult to access in rural areas. Our team developed brief behavioral sleep intervention that improved sleep, arousal, mood, cognition and inflammation (small to large effects). While telehealth improves accessibility, it is still burdensome for CGs due to inflexible scheduling and scarcity of trained therapists. Thus, more research is needed. Web delivery would increase access and web treatments for insomnia are efficacious in non-CG adults, but has not been tested in rural CGs. The proposed trial tests the novel hypothesis that web-based treatment (NiteCAPP) will improve CG health, mood, burden and cognition by targeting their shared underlying mechanisms - sleep, arousal and inflammation - thereby, returning sympathetic and hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis (HPA) functioning to normal. Demonstration that rural CGs can use NiteCAPP to target sleep, arousal/stress, inflammation and related health concerns has important implications for multiple stakeholders, including rural CGs, rural persons with dementia (PWD), their families, clinicians and policymakers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Insomnia severity; score range 0-28 (low severity - high severity)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Intensity - Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record pain intensity; range: 0-100 (no pain- most intense)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain Unpleasantness - Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record pain unpleasantness; range: 0-100 (none- most unpleasantness)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Wake After Sleep Onset - Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record wake after sleep onset (number of minutes)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Onset Latency- Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record sleep onset latency (number of minutes)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep Efficiency- Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record sleep efficiency

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Fatigue - Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record insomnia severity; range: 0-100 (no insomnia - most severe)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep and Pain Medication - Daily Electronic Sleep Diaries
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Daily electronic dairies will record daily medication consumption

primary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Perception of stress; score range: 0-40 (low stress - high stress)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Kingston Caregiver Stress Scale (KCSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver stress level; score range: 10-50 (low caregiver stress - high caregiver stress)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Dysfunctional Beliefs About Sleep (DBAS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Sleep-related beliefs; score range: 0-110 (low dysfunctional beliefs - high dysfunctional beliefs)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 mins at rest at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
primary_outcome.description: Heart Rate Variability (as measured by Holter-Monitoring)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood-based Biomarker High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (HS-CRP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Single blood draw at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood-based Biomarker Interleukin 6 IL-6)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Single blood draw at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
Single blood draw at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
Single blood draw at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

secondary_outcome.description: Modified for NiteCAPP; score range: 0-65 (least satisfied - most satisfied)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Trait and state anxiety; score range: 20-80 (low anxiety - high anxiety)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Depression severity; score range: 0-63 (normal - extreme depression)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported health; score range: low quality of life to high quality of life

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Caregiver Burden (Zarit Burden Scale)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Caregiver burden; score range: 0-48 (low burden - high burden)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of lapses of attention, memory, and cognition in everyday life; score range: 0-100 (low frequency of mistakes - high frequency of mistakes)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Dementia Patient's Caregiver Quality of Life Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life related to psychological well-being

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Objective Wake After Sleep Onset (Actigraph)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Wake after sleep onset via Actiwatch-2

Daily at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

other_outcome.measure: Change in Neuropsychiatric Inventory(NPI) Nighttime Behavior Scale
other_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up
other_outcome.description: Frequency and severity of the nighttime behavior disturbance; score range: 2-12 (low disturbance - high disturbance)

other_outcome.measure: Change in Dementia Severity Rating Scale
other_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

other_outcome.measure: Change in Patient-Caregiver Functional Unit Scale (PCFUS)
other_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

other_outcome.measure: Change in Godin Leisure-Time Exercise Questionnaire
other_outcome.time_frame: Single administration at baseline, 8 weeks, 6 month and 12 follow up

other_outcome.description: Experience with the assessments, procedures, and other features of the research study; score range: 9-90 (low satisfaction - high satisfaction)

arm_group.description: Cognitive Behavioral Treatment-Insomnia. 4 online treatment sessions focusing on behavior and cognitions related to sleep.
Sleep Hygiene and Related Education. 4 online treatment sessions focusing on sleep hygiene and related education.

intervention.description: 4 session Web-based Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Insomnia. Individualized sessions moderated by therapist.
4 session Web-based Sleep Hygiene and Related Education. Individualized sessions moderated by therapist.
intervention.other_name: Web Sleep Hygiene and Related Education (Web-SHARE)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
Caregiver Eligibility. Inclusion criteria: 1. 18+ yrs, 2. CG living with PWD, 3. willing to be randomized, 4. read/understand English, 5. insomnia diagnosis, 6. no prescribed or over the counter sleep meds for 1+ mo, or stabilized 6+ mos.
- Insomnia: 1. complaints for 6+ mos, 2. adequate opportunity and circumstances for sleep, 3. 1+ of the following: difficulty falling asleep, staying asleep or waking too early, 4. daytime dysfunction (mood, cognitive, social, occupational) due to insomnia, 5. baseline diaries indicate >30 mins of sleep onset latency or wake after sleep onset on 3+ nts.
PWD Eligibility. 1. probable/possible Alzheimer's Disease (self-report or primary care provider written confirm), 2. 1+ problem on Nighttime Behavior Inv. 3+ nts/wk, 3. tolerate actigraphy, 4. no sleep meds 1+ mo or stabilized 6+ mos, 5. untreated sleep disorder for which CBT-I is not recommended (e.g., apnea), 6. scoring <32 on Sleep Apnea scale, Sleep Disorders Ques.
Exclusion:
CG Exclusion criteria: 1. unable to consent, 2. cognitive impairment [Telephone Interview for Cognitive Status (TICS) <25], 3. sleep disorder other than insomnia [i.e., apnea (apnea/hypopnea index-AHI >15)], 4. bipolar or seizure disorder, 5. other major psychopathology except depression or anxiety (e.g., suicidal, psychotic), 6. severe untreated psychiatric comorbidity, 7. psychotropic or other medications (e.g., beta-blockers) that alter sleep, 8. non-pharmacological tx for sleep or mood outside current trial.
